inlet.description: For each of the output samples an llll of the type (el_idx1 coeff1) (el_idx2 coeff2)... is output; the sample is actually the linear combination el_1 * coeff1 + el_2 * coeff2..., where el_i is the element of the original list at position el_idxi.

objarg.name: factor_or_target_length
objarg.description: In "Multiplier" mode (default) sets the sampling factor; in "Target length" mode sets the expected output length.

method.name: bang
method.description: Performs resampling on last received llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: Any incoming llll resampled by the specified factor, according to the values of the other attributes.

attribute.name: align
attribute.description: Sets the alignment of the original llll within the resampled llll. 0 is left, 1 (default) is middle, 2 is right.

attribute.name: factor
attribute.description: In "Multiplier" mode, sets the resampling factor.

attribute.name: function
attribute.description: Sets the function used for the resampling filter.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: In "Target Length" mode, sets the total length of the output sampled llll.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Sets the way output length should be specified: either via a scaling multiplier (see factor attribute), or via an absolute target length (see length attribute). For instance, to downsample an llll by a factor of 3, use "Multiplier" mode, with 1/3 as factor; to upsample an llll so that its final length be 127, use "Target Length" mode and 127 as length.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: support
attribute.description: Sets the support for the resampling filter.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Resampling coefficients. For each of the output samples an llll of the type (el_idx1 coeff1) (el_idx2 coeff2)... is output; the sample is actually the linear combination el_1 * coeff1 + el_2 * coeff2..., where el_i is the element of the original list at position el_idxi.
